lom:description.lom:string:
"Nanoscaled science and engineering is likely to revolutionize many areas of technology over the next twenty years. Majoring in Materials Science and Engineering is the ideal way to learn all of the fundamentals that are needed for this new technology. The requirements for this degree are described in the Materials Science and Engineering section of the Stanford Bulletin and the School of Engineering Undergraduate Handbook. Electives are available so that students with broad interests can combine materials science and engineering with work in another science and engineering department.
One of the advantages of majoring in Materials Science and Engineering is that almost all undergraduates get to do a research project with one of the professors in the department. "

lom:title.lom:string: Undergraduate Materials Science and Engineering Curriculum - Stanford University
